        public void sortArray​()

      • quickSort

        private void quickSort​(T[] arr,
                       int low,
                       int high)
        Quick sort implements the divide and conquer mentality. A pivot is selected (many implementations) the array is parted in two halves, a greater and a smaller than the pivot. it iterates from beginning and end simultaneously and swaps elements to match the correct half it will then move to the halves and follow the same process

      • mergeSort

        private void mergeSort​(T[] arr,
                       int start,
                       int end)
        Merge sort is also a divide an conquer algorithm it divides the array over and over until it is each once is only one element long. At the merge phase they are put together. It is a non-in-place algorithm as many arrays are created
        Parameters:
        arr -
        start -
        end -

      • merge

        private void merge​(T[] arr,
                   int start,
                   int mid,
                   int end)
        This method is use by merge sort to join arrays back together
        Parameters:
        arr -
        start -
        mid - Is always the first index in the right side. And 1 index bigger than the left side
        end -

      • selectionSort

        private void selectionSort​()
        Selection sort finds the smallest element in an array and swaps it with the element in the first position. It will move the index and will repeat the process until the array is sorted

      • insertionSort

        private void insertionSort​()
        Insertion sort traverses the array to find largest element. When found it is Set in last position. repeat decreasing the length of the lopp

      • bubbleSort

        private void bubbleSort​()
        Bubble sort works by swapping the largest element to the end it repeats the process with length-1.

      • setValues

        public void setValues​()
        This method sets the values of the largest and smallest value;

      • simpleSort

        public void simpleSort​()
        Author: Oracle This algorithm is Java's faster version of insertion sort. I found it by looking into the JDK code in my first semester. The "break" inside loop actually makes a difference in speed.

      • heapSort

        private void heapSort​()
        Heap Sort manager/caller
